instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesn’t use intrusion detection. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
got corroded around <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5159</TRANSISTOR> before i did something when plugin charger battery removed
fan spins very loud but no display few seconds it will stop spinning the fan.
after i clean corroded parts
can on once can see apple logo but after loading dead after i repeat cant turn on again.

usb meter got 20v 1.75amp
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 13v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>   3.3v
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL> 2.8v

before and after replace <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>
23: 13v
12: 3.4v
13: 2v
22: 3.3v
29: 5.1v
21: 3.4v

nextstep?
